channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2024050718
item.description:
Report X-2024050718

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-04
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X-2024050718 RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE UNLOAD WALL. UPON ARRIVAL IDENTIFIED THE LEAKING PACKAGE. ISOLATED AND CLEANED THE AREA OF CONTAMINATION. PLACED PACKAGE AND CONTAMINATED DEBRIS IN SPILL TRAY TO TRANSPORT TO DMP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL X-2024050719 RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE UNLOAD WALL. UPON ARRIVAL IDENTIFIED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND CONTAINED SPILL, CLEANED AND PLACED ALL DEBRIS AND PACKAGE IN SPILL TRAY FOR TRANSPORT TO DMP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024050743
item.description:
Report X-2024050743

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Gene Manguso Operations Supervisor called to report a leaking pail on the dock floor in front of Bay Door 28. Gene stated one of his workers when to move the box and found that the box was a little saturated and appeared to have been leaking with in the box. Gene stated the 1 gallon pail in the box was in a bag and looked to have been leaking in the bag. Gene stated he removed the box from the dock floor and placed the pail in a recovery pail and placed it in the OSD. Safety advised Gene any time a spill is found it will need to be reported to safety immediately. Gene stated he would let safet y know before anything is done next time on a spill. Gene stated the product did not spill on the dock floor and was contained to the box. Update Gene stated it looked to be a lose cap on the pail that caused the leak.
